div.ab: Red is fire, Blue is air, White is water, and Black is the earth.

30. Green signifies Spring in the four seasons,
Red is Summer, because the Sun glares with heat;
Blue is Autumn, with its grapes nearby;
Black is Winter, gloomy, without cheer.
Thus the Colors signify many meanings.
On this, having washed my stained hands,
I will now stop speaking,
In order to guide Youth to the Lives of the Painters.
right-middleFour colors compared to the four seasons.

31. If possible, I would have discussed
other subjects or gone on longer.
But Architecture, with its related matters
such as proportion and foreshortening,
are already clearly brought to light, printed in our language.
Further, my own affairs and household business
take away my Pen and disturb me,
otherwise I would have presented a thousand things.
right-middleThat is, the Books of Pieter Coecke van Aelst on Geometry, perspective, and architecture, by Hans Bloem and others.

32. So, O Young painters, take pleasure in much
and let it serve you for the best.
Beginning in difficulty, do not scorn
the path of Virtue, for see, it leads to joy,
through sweet enjoyment of prosperity at the end.
Thus you should find examples
in the Lives and Works of the Painters,
and in reading (so I think), you will at once learn to paint.

ab.b: End of the Foundation of the Art of Painting.>
